Class ServerSend

  • java.lang.Object
    • ServerSend

  • public class ServerSend
extends java.lang.Object
    ServerSend contains methods that sends messages to the client, indicating whether corresponding methods in SenderReceive processed user inputs successfully.

    Sends client messages after completing sender operations concerning:

    • Delete Account
    • Send Message
    • Check Inbox
    • List Users
    • End Session

      ServerSend()

      Sends a general failure message to the client.

      Sends a heartbeat message to the client.

      static void sendMessageSuccess(java.net.Socket socket, byte[] buffer)
      Sends a send message success message to the client, just to let client know their message was successfully sent.

    • Method Detail

      • createAccountSuccess

        public static void createAccountSuccess(java.net.Socket socket,
                                        byte[] buffer)
        Sends a create account success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the username of the created account. Sends the account name and success opcode to client.

      • loginSuccess

        public static void loginSuccess(java.net.Socket socket,
                                byte[] buffer)
        Sends a log in success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the username of the created account. Sends the account name and success opcode to client.

      • listAllAccountsSuccess

        public static void listAllAccountsSuccess(java.net.Socket socket,
                                          byte[] buffer)
        Sends a list all accounts success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the queried account names. Sends the queried account names and success opcode to client.

      • pullAllMessagesSuccess

        public static void pullAllMessagesSuccess(java.net.Socket socket,
                                          byte[] buffer)
        Sends a pull all messages success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains all the messages in the client's inbox. Sends the messages and success opcode to client.

      • sendMessageSuccess

        public static void sendMessageSuccess(java.net.Socket socket,
                                      byte[] buffer)
        Sends a send message success message to the client, just to let client know their message was successfully sent. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer. Sends success opcode to client.

      • pushMessageNotification

        public static void pushMessageNotification(java.net.Socket socket,
                                           byte[] buffer)
        Sends a push message success message to the client, to notify that they successfully received a new message. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer. Sends success opcode to client.

      • deleteAccountSuccess

        public static void deleteAccountSuccess(java.net.Socket socket,
                                        byte[] buffer)
        Sends a delete account success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the username of the created account. Sends the account name and success opcode to client.

      • generalFailure

        public static void generalFailure(java.net.Socket socket,
                                  byte opcode,
                                  byte[] buffer)
        Sends a general failure message to the client. Takes in Socket conn, byte [] opcode, and byte [] buffer, which contains the reason for failure. Sends the reason and appropriate failure opcode to client.

      • heartbeat

        public static void heartbeat(java.net.Socket socket)
        Sends a heartbeat message to the client. Takes in Socket conn along which to send the heartbeat.
